Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: none42
Reviews.Content: Felt like we were deceived during reservation of this resort. We were kept under the impression that we would get a lakeside view but instead our view was an elevator and parking lot. I contacted front desk prior to check in and they informed me that there are no choice difference in the room views but when we arrived we found out there are lakeside or parking lot view. Disappointed at that. A tennis court would have been nice for a resort this size. The walls need to be sound proof better, our neighbors reported us for loud noise when we hear our neighbors just the same. On August 30, 2012 my family headed to the club house, I suggested to the front desk lady that this is our 2nd stay at a west gate resort and our first stay in a different West Gate in Orlando had free wifi. The front desk lady (Older blonde hair lady) grumpily told us "well you guys are not owners here". With that attitude, my family was more glad we weren't owners there. The other young ladies working the front desk on other days were more polite and respectful to us.

Reviews.Title: “4th Of July Week”
Reviews.Author: Docsports
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the week of 4th of July. We got the unit on a II trade. We were not able to get a lake-view room, which are probably the only rooms to stay in. Our one bedroom has a view of the parking lot, as most of the rooms. The condos are very clean, the bed is comfortable and the furniture adequate. It would be nice if they would spend a little on drapes. The blinds do not close adequately and there is a lot of light from the parking lot and walkways. You can also hear quite a bit from adjoining rooms. This an older property and looks it. We were in building two and the outdoor pool is quite a walk across the parking lot. The staff is very good and was responsive to everything we needed. But, there are nicer places to stay in the area. The location is a little South of Hollister, so you have a few miles to drive to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “NOT Impressed”
Reviews.Author: chiefers
Reviews.Content: First of all it was a little difficult to locate, but I liked the location away from Branson. The housekeeping crew did not do a very good job cleaning the room. The deck had not been cleaned in a while, the bathroom had hair on the floor from the previous guest, a towel was left on the floor beside the bed next to the night stand from the previous guest and I found a spider in the bed the next morning. As soon as we checked in I turned the ice maker on and it did not produce enough ice for two people to have a cold drink. We called the front office to request a bag of ice and they explained rudely that they did not provide ice and that we would have to purchase a bag from the marina. I do not believe I have ever stayed anywhere that they did not have an ice machine available for guests. We have stayed at their other resort in Branson and it was very friendly and provided ice and thought we would be as pleased with Emerald Pointe, but I was wrong. When we checked out the next morning we voiced our complaints and were told the manager would not return until 3:00 pm, no wonder the property is in such bad shaped there is no one to oversee the grounds all day.

Reviews.Title: “Still Filthy, Still Rude, Still No Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: happytillie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here once before ( bad experience) but we had friends staying here and they wanted us to give it another try so we could all be at the same location. Upon check-in they couldn't find our reservation. Luckily I had a copy of it & where I had paid with my credit card. Without that we wouldn't have had our room. Maybe that was a sign to go elsewhere. Our room was dirty & when we went to the front desk to complain within minutes after checking in we were told they didn't have another room available. They said housekeeping would come & clean our room so we all went to dinner. We came back 4 hours later & nothing had been cleaned. Back to the front desk where this woman could have cared less and was rude. Room was filthy and roaches were in the kitchen area. People next door were loud & drunk. I called front desk & the night person didn't see the problem. Loud, rude, drunk & nasty language with blairing music is a problem at midnight. Tv didn't work and fridge didn't keep proper temp. We checked out early and went to the Hilton where we were treated with respect and like a wanted guest. Avoid this property and don't bother talking with the hotel manager. He has more excuses than a high school student. He seems to be in great denial and shouldn't be in charge of a hotel when he doesn't value his guests. I am sure he will reply with a lame excuse instead of being accountable for his lack of leadership. The topper was when someone had gone thru our luggage in all 3 of our rooms. That's when we checked out and went to the Hilton at the Landing. Filed a chargeback with our credit card company and they loved we supplied them with photo's to back up our nightmare experience. Refund was immediate and they apologized for the horrible experience. Funny how the hotel never did that. Never again!!

Reviews.Title: “Scorpion in the bed!!”
Reviews.Author: leigh f
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Memorial Day weekend 2012. On the last night of our stay my son was stung by a scorpion in the bed!! We were horrified and shocked that a scorpion would even be in the room much less in the bed. We immediately contacted the front desk and was not offered any type of first aid or assistance. Luckily my husband is a police officer and has had first aid training. We immediately packed and checked out, our daughter was absolutely terrified. Once home, we had to dissect each piece of our suitcases to ensure no scorpions had crawled in our luggage. When our travel agent called to report the incident, they were told that there was not a report of this ever happening and our checkout time and date had been altered. Apparently they are trying to cover this up. Please for your safety DO NOT STAY HERE!!! I have tried numerous times to contact someone at the resort, but ironically the manager is "not available" and will not return my calls.

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast!”
Reviews.Author: Vince35
Reviews.Content: Had a blast here! The view was awesome! Loved it! The room was perfect! The bed was comfortable, even the sofa bed was comfy. VERY CLEAN!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: TaraNicole25
Reviews.Content: Room was awesome! Lake was beautiful! But the customer service was TERRIBLE! We stayed May 15 & 16th checkout the 17th. On our check out day in the morning our electricity went out and water got shut off at 930. I had just curled half my head when the electricity went off. When I went down to the office to ask when it would be back on they looked at me like I was an idiot and couldn't tell me anything so I then asked if I could stay until the electricity came back on the lady at the front said she could give me more time but if it was out a while I would have to leave. I then asked to speak with the manager she laughed in my face and said she wouldn't be back in tomorrow. This lady couldn't accommodate me at all plus her looks towards me were very rude and unprofessional. I was gonna rate this a 5 but because customer service

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, smelly, outdated, horrible service”
Reviews.Author: LisaDL1
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in our room, there was urine in our toilet and on the rim under the seat. The bed was not made and the entire room smelled musty and like urine. I was afraid to walk around barefoot, as after only 30-45 minutes my feet were black. The buildings are about 30 years old, but if I didn't know better, I would guess they were about 50-60 years old, based on the smell, filth, and decor. On the day before our departure, we returned to our room that afternoon to find a note from the front desk clerk, Sherri, and I quote: "...we had your room down for checkout this morning, our housekeeping staff went in to clean the room and went into the kitchen and found some pop in the refrigerator, they took a couple of bottles and then left the room not knowing that you still were occupying the room." If they came in to clean, how did they not know we were still there? All of our belongings were in the room, so apparently they came in to raid the fridge and then left. We also caught this same housekeeping group having a smoke break on the patio of the room they were supposed to be cleaning next door. When we raised concern to the manager, Brittany Hunter, she shrugged her shoulders and said sorry. She did offer to move us to a new room, but we declined as we were leaving the next morning. When we called the General Manager, Tom Hill, he seemed upset that we had bothered him with this kind of nonsense. By the way, we were only there for 2 1/2 days. The entire experience was a nightmare and we will never return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING!!! THEY ARE A SCAM!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bleier L
Reviews.Content: RUN as far away from this place as you can! Before you consider doing business with this company take a look at the BBB report. 653 complaints in the last 12 months.

Reviews.Title: “Good Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Marshifeld_MOWalkers
Reviews.Content: The location of this property is nice. The view of the lake was gorgeous from our 4th floor room and we had huge windows from our living area and bedroom. The screened in porch was wonderful. Very clean and nice place to stay overall. January is a great time to stay because we nearly had the place to ourselves. Our two complaints are: 1) There were maybe 6 guests total and we were roomed next to some of them. The guests next to us were very loud (no fault of the property). Even though it was January, the weather was gorgeous and so our neighbors were on the porch. We could hear them well into the night. 2) We arrived 2 hours early and the lady at the front desk would not let us check in. This would have been understandable except that she was rude about it. We spent the next 2 hours wondering if we made a poor choice. We are all about customer service. The funny thing is when we checked out the next morning she was back and was very pleasant (maybe she's a morning person and not an afternoon person?). The lady that actually checked us in was very nice and good with customer-service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful New Year's Stay at Westgate”
Reviews.Author: DebbieKansas
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Westgate Branson Lakes at Emerald Pointe. The units are very well taken care of and clean. The one bedroom unit we stayed in had a king-sized bed, a living room area with a sleeper couch, a small kitchen, a dining area, and a nice screened-in porch overlooking Table Rock Lake (with a patio table and chairs). There was a washer and dryer, and the bathroom had a nice jacuzzi tub, (which we didn't use). The only complaint I have, is that the corner shower, (which was in the same room as the toilet, tub, and sinks) had clear glass doors. For us, staying with our 2 sons, the bathroom lacked the privacy needed to accomodate 4 people. My sons enjoyed swimming in the indoor pool, and playing ping pong in the clubhouse. By the outside pool there is also a mini golf course, a small basketball court, and a horseshoe setup. There is also a large pavilion outdoors, full of picnic tables. It has 2 nice BBQ grills and a stage as well. We needed something repaired in our unit, and they had 2 men up to check it out within minutes, and had the problem fixed before the end of the day - very impressive! We would definitely stay there again. Also, here's a tip on finding the resort - it's quite a drive from the time you drive through the security gates until you find the registration building. Do not stop at the large house with white pillars just up the hill from the gate, you have to proceed down the hill directly toward the lake. Eventually at the bottom of the hill, the road takes a sharp left turn and you should soon see the clubhouse/registration center straight ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Winter Get-A-Way”
Reviews.Author: grandma80401
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while attending a wedding in the area and completely enjoyed this hotel. We stayed in a one room villa with a lake view. Even on our second floor the view was wonderful. A storm blew in and we could watch the fog and hear the ducks. Our unit had a screened porch, which would be a big plus during warmer weather. We both thought that if you are looking for a nice winter hide away, this would be a perfect place. We heard our neighbors on one occasion, but it was not a big distraction. The bed was comfortable, and we loved being able to open the blinds and see the lake with the lights on the water. We thought we were just booking a place to spend the night, but we found the Westgate to be a lovely place to rest and enjoy a quiet day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Debbie B
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I booked a 2 bedroom deluxe condo, for our daughters bday. This place is fantastic, our view was of the lake, and on the 4th floor. The stay could not have been more perfect. The staff was so friendly and helpful. The beds were very comfortable and the layout of the place was perfect. We heard no outside noise. My only disappointment was that we was only staying one night and not a week. We will be back again :) Thank you very much to all the staff, for helping make my daughters birthday so special and wonderful. I work for Expedia and i will be recommending Westgate Emerald Pointe, in the future.

Reviews.Title: “This place was great”
Reviews.Author: piper161Pennsylvania
Reviews.Content: Me and friends came to Branson just to get away and have fun. This was a great location on the lake and we had a gorgeous view from the 4th floor. The room was very modern and clean, the TV was the old tube type and didn't get too many channels, but we didn't come to Branson to watch TV. The bed and pull out sofa were plenty comfortable for sleep. The main lobby has an indoor pool, ping pong, and a game area with a mini kitchen which was nice. The staff were very helpful and gave us some assistance when we had to readjust our travel plans after our flight was cancelled due to hurricane Irene. Overall, we were very pleased with the location, amenities and staff, would defintely come back.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but could use some updating”
Reviews.Author: TexasTRVLR
Reviews.Content: Pros: Friendly staff, really nice clean pool and pool area, plenty of parking near your room, secure area with guard gate access, fairly well equipped kitchens with smooth top stoves, dishwasher, and washer/dryer. There were a couple of gas grills near the pool but the propane tanks were empty and we did not know if these were available for public use or reserved to be used with the pavilion near the pool. Each building did have a charcoal grill outside of the building. Grounds and common areas were all very clean. Plenty of trash bins outside the rooms on each floor and these were emptied often. Elevators in each building. Cons: Paper thin walls. You hear every footstep above you, every person walking or talking outside your room, and the guy snoring and people talking in the rooms adjacent to yours. No lake access for swimming. Needs lots of updating in the rooms. Loose/cracked floor tiles in bathrooms, dirty carpeting in rooms, wallpaper pealing, and fixtures loose in bathrooms. If you are wanting to go swim in the lake, try Moonshine Beach Swim area. We saw it from the water and it looked nice (see Tripadvisor reviews). We rented a boat from the State Park Marina. The boats were nice, staff was friendly, and this was a very well run operation.

Reviews.Title: “Not how it used to be”
Reviews.Author: happytillie
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times since it first opened. We have always enjoyed our stays until this year. You have to call a central call center in Florida to make reservations in which my credit card information was stolen and several charges were made on it from other countries. Some rooms are updated with flat screen tv's and others have the old style. Some have leather couches and some have cloth couches that are down right nasty from being dirty. The view from "B" side is great but their prices have skyrocketed to the point it is not worth the stay in Branson. Just came back from LA and the Hilton at Universal Studio's for a suite was less than Emeral Point. This is Branson MO and I think they forget that. Guest staying in Branson are not looking to pay Orlando prices. They still use keys that could be copied so watch what you leave in the room. I didn't know hotels still used keys. No WiFi or place to eat & it's about 7 miles back to town. Lady at the front desk with 1 tooth is clueless upon check in. The best part is the lake view which you pay for. If they are going to charge these prices then they need to offer consistency in their rooms, update rooms and offer wonderful customer service. I think they have another hotel in Branson but never stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Lady needs to take a course on customer service”
Reviews.Author: jruth327
Reviews.Content: Stayed with Family for family reunion. Some units are more undated then others but clean. Asked for bathroom light bulb to be replaced and front desk personal had to sigh mutiple times prior to saying she woud send someone up. it was changed in 5 minutes and that i think the lady had to sigh five times for each minute.Multiple people in group called to ask questions and needed assistant and came acrossed the same bad attitude. She needs to remember she is working for a resort and people are on vacation. Alot of spiders/wasps/bees. I think the outside of the place needs to be powered washed and swept. The same large dead beetle/bug laid outside our room the entire time. If you not a bug person this is not the place for you. If ypu are a light sleeper this is not for you the walls are paper thin.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is NOT a priority”
Reviews.Author: cmg1985
Reviews.Content: Beautiful views do not make up for a lack of customer service. Westgate at Emerald Pointe did not care they mixed up our reservations and they did not care that we were without electricity when we arrived at our room. They were unapologetic for the troubles they caused and did nothing to compensate us for our troubles. I would not recommend this place based on their severe lack of customer concern among other reasons. They do NOT have wifi (closest is about a 7 min drive to a mcdonalds). They do NOT have heated pools (like their website says), the ROOM is heated but not the pool. There is no access to the lake unless you have a boat. Not to mention their rooms have paper thin walls and we could hear our neighbors on every side. One with a screaming kid and one slamming kitchen cabinets at 7am. Just a poor experience overall and I am disappointed they did not treat their guests better because I plan on telling as many people as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and secluded, NO INTERNET!”
Reviews.Author: Peanutz53
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days, from May 28-June 2, 2011. Our condo, or villa, was very nice. with an end unit in building 3, 2nd floor. Whirlpool bathtub in addition to a corner shower, and two sinks in the bathroom, which I found to be a real plus! I found the absence of hooks or racks to hang our swimsuits, towels, etc to be lacking. There is a towel rack over the toilet, and that is it. Much storage in the bathroom with a closet as well as drawers under the sink. We had a one bedroom, with a king sized bed and a walk out of the bedroom to the large screened in deck. The bedroom had a tv in it, but we never turned it on. The bed was comfortable. Kitchen was a work in only kitchen with a dishwasher, and the washer and dryer (stacked) were also in a closet, and very handy to have. I found the tableware to be adequate, but barely. I think there might have been a setting for 4 people. We did not like the coffee cups at all, and went out to purchase mugs. Kitchen was very clean, as well as refridgerator and microwave. Cleaning supplies were nicely stocked. Dining room was pretty and small, nice glass top table with 4 heavy chairs. Living room consisted of a leather couch and chair, and the couch could be made into a bed. They were comfortable. The carpet was like an indoor outdoor, and could have been vacuumed again, it was gritty. From the living room we could also walk out on the deck, which had a patio table with 4 chairs. It was a great view of the Lake, and we also could watch the birds flying and fishing. There is NO internet at all. I was able to check messages with my blackberry, but if you plan on using wireless or internet, forget it. That was an annoyance and almost enough to have us leave and find somewhere else. The pool was nice, and there were two propane bbq grills close to it for use. There is also a charcoal bbq betweeen buildings for tenant use. Boats and other watersport items can be rented from the marina, which is maybe a 10 minute walk. Check-in was easy. This was a bid for vacation trip, and I paid about $60.00 per night. There were activites but we did not get involved in any. We mainly vegged out and sat on the patio and watched watercraft, people, and nature. The only restaurant that delivers is a Dominos, and it cost me $30.00 for one pizza and one sandwich, which is more than I pay in Cincinnati. But, it was the only game in town on Saturday even when we arrived. We were tired and did not want to go back out and find a restaurant or a grocery store. Food was fine. Be aware, though, and either stop at a grocery store before you come to the villa, or eat pizza. (smile) We did find the walls between condos/villas to be very thin. We could hear our above neighbors whenever they walked across the floor. Either they all were very heavy walkers or not much insulation. We also could hear our next door neighbors television, their conversations, etc. Thank goodness they were not having a party, just regular voices really carried. They probably could hear us, too. I would stay here again and next time bring my fishing tackle! Tablerock is supposed to be one of the best bass lakes around. It was a short drive to see the dam, and 4 of the locks were open, which was neat. The vacation was relaxing to us.

Reviews.Title: “overall good stay”
Reviews.Author: gabbiesmom
Reviews.Content: Our party included 2 adults, an 8-year-old, and a 15-year-old. We booked a 2 bedroom suite. Like other reviews, the room was 2 separate one-bedrooms with an ajoining door. It suited our needs fine. It offered plenty of privacy and quiet. The room looked more like a hotel than a condo. The bedding and furniture were not the highest quality, but comfortable. The kitchen was fully stocked. The floors did seem in need of a deep cleaning, as your feet did get dirty when walking barefoot or in socks. The whirlpool could have been cleaner. Thanks to previous reviews, I suggested that my spouse fill the tub and run the jets prior to getting in the bath. He found globs of hair in the jets. But, no big deal...you get what you pay for. The indoor pool was small, lukewarm, and very humid, but suited our needs. The best part of the the property was the view of the lake and the convenience of easy access to to the traffic relief routes onto 76. THe weather was cold and rainy so we were not able to use the mini golf facility. Overall, a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Guess”
Reviews.Author: FishingFool62
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this resort twice in the last two years. It is very convienent for me as i keep my boat in the dry storage at the marina. Easy access to Branson and I enjoy the peace and quiet of the lake. Will agree with others that the walls and floor are thin. Overall though I think this a great place to come to fish and spend a relaxing day on the lake.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful scenery and views from condo”
Reviews.Author: tiggrabb
Reviews.Content: My husband, his friend and son and my brother all stayed in a 2 bedroom lockout for a week. The unit was releatively quiet despite numerous posts about paper thin walls and hearing your neighbor. We had 2 kitchens, 2 washer/dryer sets and 2 living rooms and dining area's. We syated in building 2 and had a wonderful view of the lake. Right below our screened in porch was a charcoal grill. We used the gas grills over in the pavilion by the outdoor pool. We enjoyed watching all the water craft on the water and beautiful sunsets over the water. The Branson Belle came by daily. Our uit was clean, comfortable and well equipped kitchen wise. We hd a short drive to go into town, but really enjoyed the peacefulness and quiet of the lake area each evening. The staff was very friendly and no body bugged us all week except for mid week we were given a tidy up service and new towles twice without even asking. We have all ready booked a weeks stay over 4th of July in 2011 and we now have a boat so we can join those on the water.

Reviews.Title: “NICE PROPERTY...BUT”
Reviews.Author: npits
Reviews.Content: Lovely property, but not ideal for kids.Outside pool was cold,inside pool was to stuffy.No lights to play mini golf or for the basketball court. No area's of grass to do anything with your child, a person has to use the parking lot as a field(not ideal). Walls are extremely thin and no privacy on your deck. Great place just for adults. Will stay again, if not traveling with child.Staff was great and the guest were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful scenery but not impressed with resort itself”
Reviews.Author: StephsFavs
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2 children stayed in a 1B unit and we were very disappointed. Our carpet was very dirty, we had to wear shoes and/or socks inside our room, otherwise our feet would turn black. Also there was mold on the showe curtain liner. I would be embarrased as a resort owner/manager to rent these types of rooms out to people. The resort is set in a beautiful place but I think they should have built every room with a lake view and porch. The walls are very thin too.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money........”
Reviews.Author: golfbugg
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several Westgate properties, and this is by FAR the cheapest built unit I have ever stayed in. Walls are nearly as thin as the carpet. Sofa was impossible to set on without getting several pillows off the bed for support. We had requested a lake view, an was told at check-in it would cost another $80. per nite. What a rip-off! Nearest internet access in 3 miles away at a McDonald's. Maid service was once a week. Save your money, and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Loud”
Reviews.Author: Heather B
Reviews.Content: The place looks amazing. Great price for size of the room. Only one problem, you can hear everything your neighbor is doing. We wake up to the Today's show, I could hear the tv as if it were in our room. It was crazy! I had booked this condo for two nights, but we ended up at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place! Beautiful and relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: kkramerflynn
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place was warm and inviting. Can't beat the location, and the view overlooking tablerock lake was great! Yes, the walls are thin, but it didn't really impose any great inconveniences. My 12 year old boy loved playing basketball, all three kids loved the pool, my huband and I took advantage of the work out room - and we took daily runs around the neighborhood. Nice gated off area, so we felt very safe. Pet friendly, so we're thinking of bringing the famiy dog next time.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, Smokey condo, No Internet”
Reviews.Author: Mamyoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Westgate Emerald Point for 1 night on a quick weekend trip to Branson. The location is in a gated community on Table Rock Lake. As we drove into the resort around 7pm it looked wonderful. We had very high hopes- soon to be shattered. PROS: 1. Nice indoor pool w/ warm water. 2. Beautiful views of Table Rock Lake. CONS: 1. Check-in took 20 mins4 as the only front desk employee couldn't figure out how to enter our reservation into the computer. 2. Requested a baby crib and were told "no" because there was only 1 employee working. Returned 3 times to press the issue & the front desk employee finally retrieved one herself. 3. Room smelled very smokey. When neighbors lit a cigarette the smoke literally came through the vents or walls into our condo. Our clothes stunk and our family with small children had to breathe 2nd hand smoke all night...it felt like we were sleeping in a bar. 4. Very thin walls. Could hear the neighbors every time they talked. 5. No wireless internet anywhere at Westgate Emerald Pointe. With all of the properties available in Branson, do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly Awesome!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Keinika
Reviews.Content: I was totally blown away! When you open up your window, you are greeted by a beautiful shimmering lake, amazing moutains, and vast geenery. The air was fresh, the stmosphere breathtaking, and very peaceful. The only thing is that it gets very very very dark at night and you have to drive up to the resort and you can't see your hand in front of your face until you get on the property. The property is well lit. The room furniture can use an update and I was told that its going to very soon. However, it was very well kept. Fully equipped kitchen. I fell in love with their stove! Everything you can think of to have with the kitchenware. Plenty of space for food and snacks if you are looking to stock up. The shower was sooooo realxing. Beds were amazingly comfortable, but the sofabed wasn't as comfortable. Very roomy, plenty of space. Nice closet with good shelving, just kind of small. Loved the convience of the washer, dryer, and dishwasher in the room. The resort staff was ok. Some were good, some were bad. What can you do? A little distance from the strip, but it worked. Parking was good. Had elevator. Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Kim_OK
Reviews.Content: We stayed several nights in a condo in building 4. Had front and back adjoining condos. The view of Table Rock Lake is fabulous and I woke up early every morning just to sit and gaze. Loved the screened in porch. We were on the top floor so really had amazing views. I noticed no bugs/spiders at all as a previous poster stated. The rooms were very clean. There's no maid service daily if that's important to you but it was ok with us. There were plenty of extra towels and the washer and dryer in each condo is a real plus. Kitchen was fully stocked with kitchen utensils. I wasn't sure I'd like being this far out of Branson but really, it wasn't a bad drive at all...no more than 10 minutes. The area is very quiet and peaceful. We used this room through a friend who had previously rented and couldn't make the trip so there was no time-share hassle for us to worry about. We were not interested in the organized activities here but there were several things to choose from. We did take advantage of the ticket concierge for show tickets. They tell you their tickets are cheaper than box office prices but we did not find this to be true. Most were equal or even more. The convenience factor wasn't there either since they only give you vouchers and you still have to wait in sometimes long lines at the theaters to get your actual tickets. If we had to do it again, we would not use the on site ticket counter. The people working there were extremely nice and helpful so that was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Scenery”
Reviews.Author: deegeegirl
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this resort. We got it on a great deal due to it being before the start of tourist season. We paid about $65 a night for a 1 bedroom condo that included a full kitchen, washer/ dryer combo, fold out queen bed, screened in porch, separate bedroom with king bed, two tv's with cable television, and the bathroom was great with a walk-in shower and jacuzzi tub. We were blown away and will plan on going back again. The only complaint was that the floors were thin and we will ask for a top floor next time. Other than that we loved it! One thing about that time of year was that there was a lot of fog and was hard to see the surroundings until about 10 or 11am.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: celticpenguin
Reviews.Content: My Aunt & Uncle have a time share here and so we had a family reunion. Loved it! Right on Table Rock Lake, lovely views and GREAT staff. Indoor pool might be considered smallish by some but with our slew of young kids it was perfect. The outdoor pool is very nice and everyone loved the waterfall and hot tub, water on the cold side but after playing minuture golf or shuffle board it was nice to go right around the corner and do the "Nestea plunge!" Our room was not on the lakeside of the building (by choice) but everyone else's was so we got to enjoy the view & the great sunsets! Off the beaten path a bit but very quiet and you able to enjoy Branson with out having to deal with the traffic all the time.

HotelInfo.Name: Westgate Emerald Pointe
HotelInfo.Address: 750 Emerald Pointe Drive, Hollister, Branson, MO 65672
